testfrmw.h

00008  *

00010  * WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00011  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
00012  *
00013  * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
00014  * with this program; if not, write the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 59
00015  * Temple Place - Suite 330, Boston MA 02111-1307, USA.
00016  *
00017  
00018  
00019  * This file is a wrapper to use the tests from the NPTL Test & Trace Project
00020  * with either the Linux Test Project or the Open POSIX Test Suite.
00021  
00022  * The following macros are defined here:
00023  * UNRESOLVED(ret, descr);  
00024  *    where descr is a description of the error and ret is an int (error code for example)
00025  * FAILED(descr);
00026  *    where descr is a short text saying why the test has failed.
00027  * PASSED();
00028  *    No parameter.
00029  * 
00030  * Both three macros shall terminate the calling process. 
00031  * The testcase shall not terminate without calling one of those macros.
00032  * 
00033  * 
00034  */
00035  
00036 #include "posixtest.h"
00037 #include <string.h> /* for the strerror() routine */
00038 
00039 
00040 #ifdef __GNUC__ /* We are using GCC */
00041 
00042   #define UNRESOLVED(x, s) \
00043  { output("Test %s unresolved: got %i (%s) on line %i (%s)\n", __FILE__, x, strerror(x), __LINE__, s); \
00044         output_fini(); \
00045         exit(PTS_UNRESOLVED); }
00046         
00047  #define FAILED(s) \
00048  { output("Test %s FAILED: %s\n", __FILE__, s); \
00049         output_fini(); \
00050         exit(PTS_FAIL); }
00051         
00052  #define PASSED \
00053   output_fini(); \
00054   exit(PTS_PASS);
00055   
00056  #define UNTESTED(s) \
00057 {       output("File %s cannot test: %s\n", __FILE__, s); \
00058           output_fini(); \
00059   exit(PTS_UNTESTED); \
00060 }
00061   
00062 #else /* not using GCC */
00063 
00064   #define UNRESOLVED(x, s) \
00065  { output("Test unresolved: got %i (%s) on line %i (%s)\n", x, strerror(x), __LINE__, s); \
00066   output_fini(); \
00067         exit(PTS_UNRESOLVED); }
00068         
00069  #define FAILED(s) \
00070  { output("Test FAILED: %s\n", s); \
00071   output_fini(); \
00072         exit(PTS_FAIL); }
00073         
00074  #define PASSED \
00075   output_fini(); \
00076   exit(PTS_PASS);
00077 
00078  #define UNTESTED(s) \
00079 {       output("Unable to test: %s\n", s); \
00080           output_fini(); \
00081   exit(PTS_UNTESTED); \
00082 }
00083 
00084 #endif
00085
